newsitem.title: HUNGARY: MOL, Cofinec seen down on flat Budapest bourse.
newsitem.headline: MOL, Cofinec seen down on flat Budapest bourse.

text.p: Hungarian share prices are expected to remain stagnant or firm a shade on the Budapest Stock Exchange on Wednesday, but oil company MOL, printed packaging firm Cofinec and chemical firm TVK are likely to stay on the losing side, traders said.
"I expect most of the leading shares to remain steady or firm a bit," said Attila Hunyadi of Buda-Cash Brokerhaz Kft.
"MOL, however, will continue to fall as a result of the delayed energy price increase and the fact that it has not yet published its first half results," he said.
MOL has applied to delay releasing its figures saying as it is making a full audit in preparation for a further phase of privatisation later this year.
"I also expect Cofinec to go lower as it has not submitted its first half figures yet," Hunyadi said. "Very few investors buy it."
Cofinec was given permission to release its January-June figures by August 31, instead of the usual August 15 deadline.
Other traders questioned whether chemical company TVK could rise.
The market's longer-term outlook was much better, however, traders said, and Hunyadi referred to Austrian newspaper reports which saw the east European bourses as attractive.
Attila Gazdik of New York Broker Budapest said he saw demand on the market.
"After the Fed left the interest rates unchanged American investors' buying interest spread across to here," he said.
On Tuesday the BUX index ended at 3,359.54 points, up 0.06.
